cause.description:
Soulumination celebrates the lives of terminally ill children and adults by capturing on film the spirit and grace of babies who deeply touch their parents lives or the souls of adults that die while their children are young. Soulumination is founded by Lynette Johnston, a well-known Seattle photographer. Her photographs capture the brief and fragile lives of the children as they are. The spirit, movement, and emotion of each life and the loved ones who will be left behind.
1. Provide gifts for loved ones to remember the deceased.
2. Use photos to raise awareness for terminal diseases.
3. Support research into diseases/conditions.
cause.mission: provide photos for terminally ill children and adults.
cause.name: Soulumination
